sections.title: Overview: Sora 2 vs Claude Opus 4.5
paragraphs: Sora 2 (generative ai) is Sora 2 is OpenAI's latest text-to-video generation model that creates high-quality, realistic videos up to 20 seconds long from text prompts or images. Released in September 2025, it features synchronized dialogue, ambient sound effects, and background music generated natively alongside video. Its key differentiator is the ability to generate cinematic, physically accurate videos with native audio in multiple styles including realistic, anime, and stylized formats.. It's known for video-generation, text-to-video, ai-video.

Claude Opus 4.5 (llms) is Claude Opus 4.5 is Anthropic's most advanced AI model, launched in November 2025 as the world's best coding model. It features sustained performance on complex, long-running tasks and agent workflows, with two operational modes: near-instant responses for quick queries and extended thinking for deep reasoning on complex problems. Its unique value is exceptional coding capabilities, advanced agentic workflows, and industry-leading safety features with constitutional AI.. Users choose it for llm, coding, ai-agents.

sections.title: Key Features
paragraphs: Sora 2: Text-to-video generation up to 20 seconds, Image-to-video with motion control, Native audio generation (dialogue, sound effects, music)
Claude Opus 4.5: World's best coding model (per Anthropic), Dual-mode: instant responses + extended thinking, 200K token context window

verdict: Both Sora 2 and Claude Opus 4.5 are excellent AI tools. Your choice depends on specific needs: Sora 2 for video-generation, Claude Opus 4.5 for llm.
